ack.p: This study is dedicated to two leading personalities of the genetic research of forest trees in Slovakia: professor Ladislav Paule, who has always been (and still is) the spiritus movens behind the population and evolutionary genetics research of trees and wildlife in Zvolen, and Dr. Andrej Kormuťák, who was the first to introduce marker studies in that-time Czechoslovakia, and still has remained the gravity point of tree genetics in Nitra.
The review was supported by a grant of the Slovak Grant Agency for Science VEGA 1/0029/20.
